subject: RE: [junit] newbie question
msgSnippet: import the following classes import junit.framework.Test; import junit.framework.TestCase; import junit.framework.TestSuite; instead of import
messageBody:
import the following classes
import junit.framework.Test;
import junit.framework.TestCase;
import junit.framework.TestSuite;

instead of
import junit.framework.*;

the textui is not defined in test but junit
so write
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
instead of
test.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
it will work fine.
tariq

-----Original Message-----
From: Jeff Taylor [mailto:jeff@...]
Sent: Thursday, August 30, 2001 11:54 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] newbie question


This is probably obvious/stupid, but I'm trying to get a simple test
suite (my first w/ Junit) to compile and I'm getting the following
error's. Might anyone have a clue? Thank much, in advance!

-Jeff

-------build errors --------
C:\javac RetrieveItineraryTest.java
RetrieveItineraryTest.java:5: TestCase() is not public in
junit.framework.TestCase; cannot be a
ccessed from outside package
public class RetrieveItineraryTest extends TestCase {
^
RetrieveItineraryTest.java:10: call to super must be first statement in
constructor
super (name);
^
RetrieveItineraryTest.java:29: cannot resolve symbol
symbol : constructor RetrieveItineraryTest (java.lang.String)
location: class acctest.RetrieveItineraryTest
suite.addTest(new RetrieveItineraryTest("testGetNumLines"));
^
RetrieveItineraryTest.java:36: cannot resolve symbol
symbol : class TestRunner
location: package textui
test.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
^
4 errors

-------test suite --------------

suite.addTest(new RetrieveItineraryTest("testGetNumLines"));

//return suite;
return new TestSuite(RetrieveItineraryTest.class);
}

public static void main(String args[]) {
test.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
}
}
